column4: Hey, I have a really old PC and I was wondering if it would be a good idea to install Ubuntu onto it. I am currently running the live CD but its really slow. I dont know where to check for specs, but its roughly a AMD Duron 900MHz with just above 300mb ram, and 10 GB HDD space
LiveCD is slow by itself, not because of a slow computer, but because of slow read from CD/DVD
I can install Ubuntu and install the xfe pacages later to make it Xubuntu right?
Because I dont really have the internet to download abother CD... hehe
if you don't use compiz, etc., the computer should run ok
unless you have a good 3D accellerator
(I tried \n\n also) It says: ERROR 413: Request Entity Too Large.

The reason, I have to add this header is because, the server with this image doesn't provide Content-Length header, and download always breaks at different places in the middle, showing 100% downloaded, but I know that the download is incomplete, but the actual image on the server is complete.
I dont really want compiz or anything to work. Just want a PC where they can use Internet, (Facebook and Gmail), work on documents and spreadsheets... Nothing fancy
should work fairly well, I have a 700Mhz Celleron with Kubuntu, and it runs fine.
How much ram do you have on that PC?
but I have 768Mb of Ram on that comp
how do I specify a Content-Length header in wget?
